review: Self seating, husband and I went and sat next to the bar in a tall booth.  -Table was dirty but no other tables available (that we could get happy hour) -Took some time for someone to come ask us what we would like to drink. -Really loud table near us (not tgif fault) but then the background music got turned way up. ( Husband and I were having to talk pretty loud to hear one another) -Menus are beat to hell, ripped,really dirty, pages falling out. Just all bad. -Happy hour drinks smallest amount of alcohol and watered down. -Portions are a lot smaller than other TGIF I've been too  For being in a busy spot in Dos Lagos  I would've thought it be a better experience, the waitress was nice and attentive though, didn't catch her name but she had a noticeable accent. (Saturday night ~10pm) Gotta say TYLER MALL LOCATION IS MUCH BETTER

I am not pleased at all with the service k received at this location. I get only an hour lunch and yesterday I called for pick up. I placed my order an hour before I was going to pick up which as at 11am and let them know I'd be there at noon. I get there 3 minutes after 12pm and my order was not ready. Mind you there was barely anyone there so they weren't busy at all. Then the lady at the front had to look for someone to run my card and it took forever!  She went to the back to get my food and that took a while only to come back and my payment was still not processed. After all this i only had about 15 minutes left to even eat my lunch by the time I got back to my office because they took so long even though I told them I'd be there at noon and they had an hour to have my order ready. It was ridiculous.

I gotta say we've been to a couple of TGIF's and this one has always disappointed . First time our waiter was rude too our son and just had a bad attitude in general. We had only gotten our drinks so we paid for our drinks and canecelled the food and left. Second time around we didn't want to drive to riverside location so came back here. Again another waiter was just giving us the stink eye and the place was a ghost town. We ordered some drink s again, my beer was good but my wife's drink tasted funky, we took a closer look and the drink was filled with PAPER! We brought up to their attention and they took care of the charge for that drink. We are never going back there again save your gas and go to the riverside location!

I'm giving 3 stars only because our server was attentive and great.  I had came here to meet up with an old co worker and his fiancé with my fiancé as well. We thought it would be cool since we had been seeing the $10 unlimited appetizers deal on commercial basically every day. So we decided to come check it out because it was a great deal.  Our wait was 20-25 minutes so I decided to grab a couple drinks from the bar before we got seated. Anyways it took about 15 just for the bartender Allyson to acknowledge us. Now at least SHE did acknowledged us because several of the other bartenders behind the bar didn't even notice we were there. The reason for the 3 stars is because not only did it take 15 minutes for us to even get a drink order in, but after that I waited for another 15 minutes just for the raspberry basil margarita as well as a mojito. Why does it take 15 minutes just to get a drink order placed & another 15 to get our drinks.  Meanwhile of course we had gotten sat, so my fiancé went to our table while I waited at the bar for our 2 drinks still. I couldn't believe I wasn't able to get a drink before we got sat with an estimated seating time of 25 mins max. I honestly would have been better off waiting to get drinks until we got sat because at that point it she was sitting alone & I was waiting at the bar alone.  The appetizers were okay, the wings i'd say is the best thing to get out of all of them, since we ended up trying everything. The wings are definitely the best bang for your buck. The potato skins were okay, and just because i felt like there was too much potato VS cheese/bacon bites. Sauce with them is a must. Overall pretty mediocre service & okay food. But I guess that is what you get for $10 unlimited appetizers, obviously didn't expect the BEST appetizers. The raspberry basil margarita was great tasting though to end on a more positive note!

I'm sure the manager of this restaurant was hoping this review wouldn't happen. Me and my friend decided to go to fridays after a long spa day. The waitress we had was very nice and very friendly. However, my experience was not well at all. Food was okay not the best. But I first noticed that my cup for my water wasn't very clean. Stuff was stuck to it. But I decided not to say anything. The waitress brought me another water and while I was sitting there I discovered a fingernail inside my water. yes FINGERNAIL. I was so nasty. But what really pissed me off was that the manager tried to Prove me wrong. She made so many excuses of what it could've been. She pretty much told me I'm wrong. This picture shows I'm not wrong. I will never come here again

From the start the experience was bad. Server said he was either training or had someone he was training but that he couldn't remember her name but that we would meet her. We never met her.... and he only came to the table twice.  The food was horrible! My steak was over cooked. Server basically told me what sides I was getting instead of asking me which sides I would like. I had to tell him no and what I actually wanted. The mashed potatoes tasted like they were reheated and came from a bag and the broccoli was mushy. My whole plate of food was soaking in butter and oil. My husband got the fried shrimp dinner and it was a portion of a kids meal for $18.00 fries were rubbery and cold and the shrimp was way over cooked tasted like you were eating rubber bands. The server never gave us refills  on our waters and I asked for lemon and never got it.

I don't go here much and I don't know why. I went on Saturday night and had an amazing meal! This was the first time I tried their Jack Daniels Chicken Breast and it was great! it was also nice to know that Jack and Coke is only $5 on Saturday and their happy Hour wine by the glass is an awesome deal! The service was quick and our server was very friendly. I will have to return to this place more often!

We wanted to take our son out to dinner and a movie for doing well on tests in school. Our movie was at 8:40. We arrived at Friday's around 7:00pm and were told it would be a 15 minute wait. 40 minutes later we were seated. After being seated at 7:40 we waited 20 minutes before anyone came to our table. At 8:00pm a server came and took our drink order . We asked if we could order everything because we were seeing a movie at 8:40. She took our order but we didn't see her for another 20 minutes. At 8:20 I had to stop her and ask if we could at least get my sons drink (he ordered a slushy). She said it was at the bar and she would get it shortly. She then brought me my iced tea and 5 min later brought my son a melted slushy . At 8:35 we decided we had to leave . We hadn't received our appetizer or soups yet and we knew we wouldn't be able to eat and watch the movie . The server told us not to leave because our food was sitting on the slide. She then brought a bunch of food over none of which was ours . Turns out it was the table next to us who arrived a good 20-30 minutes after we had been seated. They ruined our night out and didn't even offer an apology. They made us pay for our drinks before we left. Horrible service . Would not recommend .
**** Warning *****  Wednesday night karaoke night. That plays SAD,  DEPRESSING MUSIC!  Dj sucks  Good happy hour  Don't Come  On  Wednesday  Your DJ SUCKS!
Love the food but the service sucks!!! Bar is way under staffed at 4:30pm. Server didn't fill our beverages until we asked. Waited 35 minutes to get my check
Good location for dinner. Was told I am no longer able to substitute two optional sides on certain dishes anymore, so now you are forced to pay extra for additional sides that you want to eat.

My wife and I went there tonight for the $10 endless Apps they advertised . However when we arrived the price had changed to  $12 despite the fact that they are still advertised on TV for $10. The food was just ok but the service was decent.  The extra 2 bucks isn't going to break me but it smells distinctly like false advertising.  That alone gives me a bad taste in my mouth worse than the food.  BTW. That restaurant could use a serious house cleaning.  The hostess showed us to a table that still had bits of food crumbs from the previous tenant.  There was dust evident everywhere.  Especially with the late afternoon sunlight shining through the windows.

Poor customer service! We came trying to get to the Happy Hour. There were so many obviously vacant seats but they made us wait telling us there are none. When we got seated, five minutes past the happy hour- they would not consider us! Paid full price from another long wait of a dinner! If you value experience and time, this is not your place and, thus, an antithesis of TGIF!

Party of 4 sat at the bar for 25 minutes and was never acknowledged. Even with the "call server" blinking light! This place is a joke, never coming again.  3 people at the bar that work there and all they did was talked to each other and counted their tips. I noticed other people just leaving the bar as well. Horrible management that doesn't create urgency.

The server we had (Colby), was so on point. Very friendly and attentive, checked on us, always refilled our drinks. He made it feel like we were at a premium restaurant. Hostess was great as well, very friendly. Best TGI Friday's experience​ I've ever had.

Giving five stars on customer service because our server Colby was fantastic. He was super attentive, offered extra sauce on our orders and was really friendly. It made our whole group enjoy our dinner so much more because he checked in to make sure everything came out okay and was to our liking. He didn't mind splitting our checks and actually offered without us even having to ask which is great because a lot of servers hate doing that. It was refreshing and very happy to have dined there tonight!

I've been coming to this Friday's for a really long time now and should honestly have probably written this long ago, but better late than never, right??    I'd like to give a shoutout to the awesome bartenders who have continuously given me and my friends the greatest service since day one and the managers who have always delivered

We came here to eat with the boyfriends family for happy hour. Our food had taken forever to come out  and my boyfriends family already had theirs. They finished eating and our food had yet to come out.  This would have been a bad experience, but Jenni our waitress and Wade the manager were great.. They were very apologetic and attentive to us. Wade compt us our meal and also gave the boyfriends family a discount. That was very nice of him to do. They provided us great customer service and I appreciate them trying to make up for our food arriving late.  Thank you Jenni and Wade

Always a great place to come and have a great time with the family. We had a great time here and great service from everyone especially our server Charlotte!! She guided us well through the menu and was very attentive with our needs. For sure coming back and hopefully she can help us again!

TGI Fridays has very good food has has kept me coming back for years. Sundays are best as they have happy hour all day with 1/2 price appetizers. Excellent buffalo wings! This place also carries one of the best steak sauces ever that you cannot find in stores, Jack Daniels steak sauce! I really enjoy their Grilled chicken and cheese plate with their very good tasking mash potatoes. Great burgers, great fries. My favorite dessert here is the Brownie Obsession. It is delicious! I really like this location as it is much less crowded than the others.
Great food. Great vibe was here on a Saturday night the DJ was great . Loved the atmosphere not all TGIF's have a DJ. You will have a good time! Happy hour 10 pm to 2am.
Jordan!! So much fun! Thanks bitch!!!  Potstickers and garlic Parmesan boneless wings were good.
They don't participate in promotions that you see on tv and the booths are dirty and sticky. There's dust that's stuck to the chairs. This place is gross, won't be back.
TGI Fridays boasts about their new selection and "hand crafted dishes."  Still tastes frozen. I spent 65.00 tonight and are not c to come back.

Are you kidding me this guy Justin is a joke. I called Friday's corporate office and was forwarded to the Philippines for their customer service. A lady answered the phone took all my information and said I would receive a phone call back in 48 hours. Never happened! We posted the same review to Facebook and go the reply that investigation needed to take place. Justin you have my information contact me or we will continue to blast your establishment.

This place has always been good since I can remember. The food are always delicious and their huge selections of drinks are top notch. If you are wondering what to try I would recommend their jack Daniels burger, that is my favorite as well as many others. I usually come here with my girlfriend and we are never disappointed. The service is quick and the waiters and waitresses are always nice.

Not impressed with service.  Serving was a lot smaller than was expected for the high price tag.  Unless I have a coupon or a discounted promotional entree offer, I will not be running to TGIF any time soon.  Food was not all that flavorful, to make it a 'must return'. Service was good, but waiter only checked up on us once. Literally had to create a scene to get waiter to get us a refill.  Then, when the bill finally came, it gave tip options of 18, 20 & higher percentages.  What happened to 15%?  I left a 15% tip, although I felt his service wasn't worth 5%. If you are in pursuit of a hearty, flavorful meal, at just the right price, do not stop here.  :(  Sorry...

Sat there for 20 minutes before our order was taken, then another 65 minutes our food was served. The place was not even busy and we all just ordered the specials. Steaks were way overlooked!  We had to complain to the manager to get our food served, then they charged me for the entire bill and didn't even offer dessert. I have gone there several times, but will not go back. If you are hungry, I would suggest going somewhere else because you will have a long wait for your food.
Very good food, cheese cake is the best around. Katie P. Is our favorite server. Everyone is great. Great location too.

We three came here for a Sunday lunch, and had to wait only about 10 minutes for a table.  Debbie, our server, gave us great recommendations that we ended up ordering.  We ordered a few appetizers, as well as a salad and the black bean burger.  I'm happy to know that they offer that vegan/vegetarian item!. The black bean burger is spicy, just so you know, which I enjoyed.  My favorite was the berry smoothie!

I find it interesting and sad that several reviewers complained about the $10 TV special on the ribs. I went last night with friends. One order the 1/2 rack and the server said they were offering a full rack for $10. Deal! I got the same. Glad I did after reading the reviews about the salads. Ribs were very good, as was the service. Overall, I was very pleased with dinner. I do wish the "specials" (TV advertised or not) were listed somewhere at the table or in the menu. After reading other reviews, I won't be heading to this location for an advertised special that may or may not be honored. There needs to be some sort of a dress code for servers, too. Several looked like they should work at the circus ... that's OK if this was supposed to be a kids' restaurant  ... but one female server was dressed like a bouncer from some sleezy biker bar. Really management?

I'm going out on a limb and giving them 2 stars. i purposefully visited twice to see if the hustle and bustle of a Friday night versus a less busy Sunday night would help improve my overall guest experience. It did, but not much.  There was a decent wait time of 45 minutes on Friday and no wait time on Sunday. The atmosphere is great on either night! It's TGIF, it's moderately loud, the bar area is packed and social with people laughing and watching tv and everyone appears happy and upbeat.   Friday night, the food was perfect and our drinks could have been better. We did return one drink to the bar for something different due to overall quality. Our server was another story. In his defense, he did say that he was new. It took more than 10 minutes to order for 4 people. He had a very hard time hearing our order and was unfamiliar with the menu. As we were bidding farewell to my niece and new husband, we celebrated by ordering a round of drinks and requested a shot as a side. Our shots were added into our drinks before arriving at the table. Admittedly, I am a little picky about this. I felt that the shots should have been separate as you are billed separate. To correct this, he offered to do it next time. There wasn't a next time. They're flight back to Guam was leaving at 4am from LAX and it was very late already. Sunday my daughters and I went after shopping. It was quieter but still a great atmosphere. Great server. Our potato skins arrived looking like over cooked taco shells with dried up cheese and not a bacon bit to be found.  The manager was very accommodating and resolved the issue quickly! My croutons in my salad were definitely stale. Everything else was perfect. Not sure I want to spend more money here though.
Just had dinner and it was so good!!! The Vanilla Bean Cheesecake is to die for. I think it is my favorite dessert right now. Great service too!!

We eat dinner in the bar at least once a week. The atmosphere is cool, the food is always good and the service is always great. You can't beat TGIF value if you eat in the bar during happy hour. Love this place in Corona. It seems to have better service than other TGIF restaurants that we have been to.
I always tell myself I'll never come back because the food sucks. Unfortunately I always forget. On the other hand, Katie's service is top notch!
Pretty good! Come here a few times a year for a quick and easy meal! Service is a little slow but we aren't usually in a hurry!

My boyfriend and I come here about once a week or so for a quick bite and a few drinks. We always sit in the bar, everyone has always been very friendly & provide great service. However, one night we asked if they were still promoting 'endless apps' and a bartender we've never seen before (not sure his name) seemed very let down, almost as if he instantly judged us for wanting to order the 'cheap promo'. I have worked in the industry for 8+ years, so I'm not a difficult table, and I tip on the amount the bill should be, not just the cheap promo price. He didn't seem to pay us any attention the rest of the night, regardless of the fact that we didn't order endless apps. My boyfriend requested steak sauce and napkins which were never brought to us either. Thankfully we haven't had this particular bartender wait on us again, and we've continued to have great service. The food is mediocre for a chain restaurant, drinks are always good though. It's a convenient place to go since we live across the street.
This place is a joke. They don't participate in the national ads so don't look for the $10 specials. They are rude,and their advertising is very misleading.
Living in Dos Lagos, this is one of my favorite spots. I know all the waitresses and managers. If you were in the area you have to stop by

Every time we come here they never disappoint some days we have to wait longer but it's understandable it's dinner time and it's busy my family loves coming here they have something for everyone and their food is great and the service is amazing.
I didn't like that they came to your table to take any alcoholic drinks away without given a 15 minute warning. The guy stood their till we gave our drinks. All I ask is a heads up..
I loved the ribs I had they were delicious and the service we got was great it really is appreciated! Thank you so much!!

I am a fan. They offer some pretty awesome deals sometimes and tonight was a bogo entree that we both enjoyed. I got the steak and lobster. YUM and hubby got the salmon. Two awesome meals for $32 Also our waitress was adorable and on top of it. I believe her name was Hanna? I love this location so much better than the Tyler Mall TGIFridays (you know someone was killed there, right?) They are too busy, loud and long wait time to sit. Not here in Dos Lagos. Ok it was a Monday night, but still a better location for my happiness.

Never disappointed coming to this location. I always get the same thing the Sedona black bean burger and it is amazing!! It is very tasty and one of the best tasting veggie burgers I've tasted. Kaytlen was our server and she is great! Very friendly and welcoming. Their teas and smoothies are awesome as well! Great atmosphere. You go tgif!

Wings were good. BBQ ribs were not! They were not good at all just the taste of the meat was not good. Sat at the bar and it took about 5 mins after my food was delivered to get a refill and some ranch. But this review is about the ribs. No bueno.
My wife an I always eat in the bar ? The bartenders are great an always take care of us.

Great place for happy hour. Cozy booths for 2-3 for the bar. You may want to get here early for happy hour to get a booth, if you're coming on a Friday. Happy hour prices are great. I've only gotten appetizers here. They are consistently good. A nice place to go before or after a movie. Within easy walking distance of the movie theater.

I've been going since it's been opened up to my 21st birthday in which they (the employees ) had amazing service to my every need. I'm a family man and completely would bring my kids any time. Don't even have to mention the food because what I do order is so complex it's supposed to come butchered but never does. Yum yum

The food was delicious. The service was acceptable. The place was just kind of icky. Previous guests with children (I'm assuming) played and smeared the photos on the wall. The menus we crusted and/or sticky. The floors were littered with debris and in general just seemed greasy. The silverware was clean and the food was tasty, but I was afraid to touch anything more than I had to. A little more effort and attention to detail would be a nice upgrade.

Stopped by for an impromptu drink around 2 & after looking at the menu preferred Kobe sliders & a basket of sweet potato fries.  Loved the sliders & the 3 were plenty for me & my husband.  The fries..Yum!!  Perfection and wonderful waitress.

This place is okay. Our service seemed kind of slow but our waiter was very nice. I got the Cajun shrimp pasta which was yummy. My boyfriend got the all you can eat appetizers but you can't even take a bite to try his food or else the manager will charge you an extra $12 just because you took a bite out of it! I think that rule is so stupid! It did not happen to us because we were warned not to do it, but seriously?! I mean I could understand if I didn't order anything but I ordered a meal too! Also, they need to clean they're beer/drinks menu because my pages were stuck together and there was mold growing inside from what looked like a piece of lettuce. It smelt so bad when I opened that page -_- overall, I don't know if I would come back to tgifs

Should be 1 1/2 ... Sad to say because food is delicious, just don't expect to eat in a timely manner or everyone at once. Ok, yes our visit was on a early Friday, 5pm with one ten year old. Hubby and I ordered a mixed drink and our daughter a Shirley temple, her's came about ten minutes before ours and another ten to take our meal order. It was not busy yet and no line either. We ordered our meal, again our daughters burger arrived 25 minutes before I asked for the manager who apologized said he would check and another ten minutes, by now we had lost our appetite to disgust. Total 38 minutes after our daughter ours was set on the table. No compensation offered, not as much as a complementary dessert for our daughter who sat patiently annoyed too, she wanted to go home. Sorry Friday's, you have lost us as a patron.
Horrible customer service. Called for pick up order where Ashley answers the phone, put me on hold both times and hanged up.

My friend Brittany and I were there tonight. We had the best service by our waitress Samantha. She was really chill and out going. Best service in a long time. Great beer and food. Thanks so much for your amazing service. Kyle

Love this tgis. Went to one in riverside and the bar wasn't as good as corona.. Come here at lest 3 4 times a week. Bartenders are great evan is the best bartender.  Love the happy hr n endless appetizers . Great place to go and hang out

Wow, it's been a while since I visited a  TGIF Fridays establishment.  We had lunch the other day at this location.  1. Fast and friendly service.  2. Great happy hour prices. 3. Short bread pizza, spinach dip  and buffalo wild wings. - great no complaints  4. Lots of TV's to watch games.  I would come back.....
Food is a bit above average, mix drinks are usually pretty strong which is never a bad thing

Sam the bartender is rad. She's full of recommendations, let's you know how to save $ and accumulate points for free meals and deals and is a ball of energy. She's also really good at remembering names which is always impressive to me for some reason.  Sam is super attentive as well, got our orders taken and placed quickly, even with everyone else she had to take care of. I'll keep my fingers crossed that she's always working whenever we come back!

Just had lunch here and the food was great but what was even better was the service from Katelyn. She was incredibly attentive, non intrusive, and was out standing at meeting all our needs. I rarely come to Friday's because the food is typically just "okay" but with service like this we just might have to stop in more often. Good times!!
Sat in the bar for late night happy hour Sunday night with my husband and Kristina was our bar server and she was awesome. Best service we have had at a Friday's

I have never had bad service here, but today was awful.  The 8 of us were seated quickly, most of the seats were filled but not all.  It took 25 minutes to get our food. My son-in-law received the wrong order and so they graciously made the right order and comped his meal. Though by the time he received his food we had all completely finished eating our meals. We were brought one refill of beverages but our glasses were empty with no further refills. There were no paper towels in the women's restroom either.

Brought my teenage kids here for lunch today.  We were seated right away as they weren't too busy.  Once seated however, we sat there over 15 minutes while our waitress continually ignored us and never came to our table.  After watching a couple was seated and immediately taken care of, we got up and walked out.  Terrible customer service. I can understand if the waitress was busy, but she walked past us at least 10 times and never acknowledge our existence. Not sure if I'll ever return again.

Foods always good, service is good too from what I've experienced. My only complain is the portions are too small. I love sweet potato fries so I got those instead of regular fries with my sandwich and the waitress had told me they were a $1.80 more, which is fine. But for paying the extra price I would assume you would get served extra fries. I got barely a handful. Next time I guess I'll just have to ask for extra and hopefully not be charged for them.

Our server Brett was so great! He was very helpful suggesting a sauce for my dads fish and chips and very fun and easy to talk to and joke with. TGI Fridays never disappoints! Amazing food and service!
The food is over cooked. Not a great experience. Being it was the first time to this location.

Upgrading my review after our visit tonight.  While other restaurants in the area had long waits we were able to be seated here after 5 mins.  Friendly and quick staff.  Only complaint is that my fries were cold when they came out otherwise I would have given another star.
Horrible service and food was cold. Waited 25 min for food to come out. And had to send it back waited another 20 min. For redo order to come out.

Well I wont be coming back for a meal anytime soon. The menu has changed with less options. All the prices have gone up. I ordered a cheeseburger and side salad. I have had bigger and better burgers from carls jr. The portions are super small. My wife ordered  a chicken sandwich and the chicken portion was the size of my pinky finger.. the service was decent but the food was not that good.

Friday's has always had high standards for their staff. This location however takes the cake in my opinion. The servers are always pleasant. The food comes out in a timely matter. They make sure my "Stripes" are entered correctly and at their highest value. I keep coming back, and the crew here keep finding new way to "1up" the last visit. Cheers!
Right off the bat, Allyson ( one of the bartenders ) was fantastic! Great service from her and everyone else. Food was great and drinks were on point. Thank you!

First things first: this place is not kid friendly. Yes they do offer high chairs/car seat holder chair things, but still doest suffice.  So goddamn loud in here cannot think!!  Our server was blah, like really blah. Kept hearing her voice and it made me cringe.. Not once did she offer us refills on water or even checking on the quality of our meals.    My French dip sandwich was okay. Just okay... Portion was small and I could've gotten a better sandwich from Wendy's.

Just left here and it took 2 hours. Really our waiter  Sucked never came back no refills . No dessert . Just wow and the Manger said oh well we're busy wow really Juan the Manger never sent us our gift card either it's been 6 months.  Save your money

Overall experience was ok.  The restaurant is clean, and the staff was very friendly, but as always the food wasn't very good.  I generally try not to eat at these type of chain food resturants, the food is highly processed with lots of salt and I always feel gross after eating their food.

This is my favorite place to dine at.  The bartenders are excellent and always are courteous.  In addition, the food is always tasty.  This is one of the best TGIF's in CA! Yup I said it. Go here you will not be disappointed.
Came in for a birthday celebration on a tuesday, drinks and apps took forever an the desert never arrived . Will be taking business else where next celebration.

If I could give a minus 5 Stars I would for the TGI Fridays in Corona. The manager Juan Martinez is terrible and a liar. My family with a party of ten ate lunch at the Fridays in Corona on 09-17-2017 at the conclusion of the meal my sister attempted to pay for the $200 bill with her credit card, Juan Martinez came to our table and stated that her card was denied, I gave him my credit card and he also returned stating that my card was denied, I gave him a third card and he also returned saying that that card also was denied. I ask Juan to double check at another terminal to see if it was his machine, Juan said that all the machines are the same. I told him that it's no way that three credit cards that are from three different banks could get denied. Juan "Shrugged" his shoulders and said we had to pay in cash. While talking to Juan my sister checked her balance on her card and she had plenty money on the card plus more. I knew both my cards had enough money on them to cover the bill, and after exiting Fridays I call both credit card company's and they concurred. Juan Martinez who's the manager "lied" about all three cards and purposely attempted to embarrass me and my family. I will write the VP of Fridays and request the termination of Juan Martinez! Terrible,Terrible service! Also I'm telling everyone I know in the Corona area not to patronize Fridays as long as Juan Martinez is the Manager!

So rumors are you are a cheap date, bippie?  Eating out not on your agenda?  Do a numbers crunch. We...did...and ended up doing a Happy Hour date! Come in on Sundays, and it's Happy Hour... all... day...long... both in the dining room and the bar.  Besides a good reduction in price for a few signature mixed drinks, the Electric Lemonade, Ultimate Margarita, and the Long Island Iced Tea, they also have certain beers on sale. Or you could do water? And most appetizers (not platters) are 50% off. Such a good deal. Me? I go for the shrimp cocktail. Happy hour price? $5 for a dozen nice sized shrimp with a good tasting cocktail sauce. I cannot resist this one. Then ask for some free crackers? There is quite an appetizer menu, you can see some of them on their website. HH also offers cheapo cheese burger sliders ($1.50 ea), or a basket of seasoned fries for $1.50 (I think). I can bet even you will find something satisfying.  Stretch that $$ and walk away full and happy. What will you do with all that money you saved? I dunno, you work it out.
Wade was extremely accommodating to our family, he made sure to take care of our order and our needs. Extremely satisfied and will be referring friends here for their great service and great food!

Unfortunately this TGIF is run by some cheapskate that doesn't honor the deals advertised online. As I had business in the area on consecutive days, I ate here two days in a row. I came away from the experience thinking that I should start a website covering just lunchtime specials.  That being said, I can't be considered a fan of franchise, factory food but there are instances where the whole equals more than the sum of the parts and usually it's because of the service, which can make or break ANY meal. In the case of this particular TGI Fridays, at lunchtime at least, the endless lunch combined with an exceptional, personable server -- in my case Suzy -- combined to make for a very good lunch experience.  For $6.95 how can you beat all the soup and salad you can eat WITH a drink? Your choice of two crisp, fresh salads (Ceasar or house) combined with your choice of five different hot soups, is an unbeatable deal. And this I believe is done corporate-wide at TGI Fridays. Normally I like to frequent individually owned establishments, if for nothing more than variety, and in the case of family-style restaurants, the daily specials that usually offer a great value. And I realize that the experience at chain establishments usually is fair at best. so when a "food factory" is hitting on all cylinders, as has been my experience with this TGI Fridays, it comes as something of a surprise. I think that this endless lunch special is an exceptional value, so much more so than Souplantation even though they include a pasta choice without much flavor and desserts, which IMHO, are almost uneatable. But again, it's the service that can make an OK meal very good and in my case, with Suzy at least, the service has been uniformly excellent. It's rare to find a server who knows exactly when to return to the table to check on things, but she comes back when I'm ready for another round.  If you visit this TGI Fridays, ask to be seated in Suzy's section. If you're on the management team at this location, Suzy should be training all of your serving staff.  Food is OK, probably a bit above three stars, but service and value (at lunch) rank five out of five stars, thus the overall rating of four stars out of five.

Probably the slowest and worst service I've ever received at any restaurant in this location also waited 10 minutes and finally left the second time I was here because nobody notice I was waiting that long with my party so I walked out and we went to Wood Ranch where we received perfect service. Honestly not sure if our waitress' name was Julia or Juliett (most likely Julia?) but anyways came here today (Sunday) after church with my family around 12:30-1. She was very attentive and overall a great waitress. Food came out great as always. Overall great experience.

I have to give a shout out to our waitress tonight, Dani. It was a full house, she was ON it, never left us wondering, had an answer for everything, and went above and beyond for us. I was having an issue with my rewards, and since it couldn't be resolved via the app, she found an alternative. Dani was SUPER friendly, always smiling, and she made our evening much more enjoyable. Thank you. I wish more servers had your upbeat attitude!

I haven't been on yelp in months but logged back on just to write about how TERRIBLE of a time we had here! We waited almost 30 mins at our table without anyone checking on us before my husband went and asked the manager if we could at least get some drinks started. Drinks came and they forgot mine. Our waiter came and was pushing gifts cards on us. When they brought my drink it wasn't the right one. I asked for the right one and got charged for it. It took a very long time before our food arrived. My food came first and we didn't have any silverware. It took about 10 minutes before I got a fork so of course my food was cold now. They didn't even bring my husband silverware. They got his order wrong so his food took even longer. Even after his food finally came he still had to wait for silverware. We didn't get to eat dinner together and neither of us even finished because we were so frustrated. I am a very patient person and totally understanding when a business is busy because I used to work in a restaurant but this was ridiculous! We spent about 2 hours there! We don't go out often because we have young kids so this was extremely disappointing. Especially since we wasted $70 on all this!

No stars, for starters staff are RUDE and the manager is ever WORSE. I ordered my food, not only did it come out wrong (no big deal just fix it) but the manger was incredibly rude and made me feel stupid as hell. Not one apology, waited almost an hour for the correction, I ended up cancelling it because everyone at my table was finished and I was over it at that point. I left and didn't even get my iced tea  on the house as courtesy.

Servers are friendly and well trained. Chicken BBQ salad is good but portion size is very small for $12 price. The nacho grande is also $12 but chicken was dry and stale. Either they defrosted it in a hurry or it was uncovered in the fridge for awhile. The French fries were excellent!

I used to come here a fair amount for happy hour in the bar area.  The price is right for happy hour and the bartenders are all very friendly and personable.  I would rate this a bit higher just due to that, however, the food is still of average corporate chain restaurant quality and the one time I ate in the restaurant, the servers were not even a fraction as good as the bartenders.

Can I leave this place a zero?? Food burnt, food cold, some food never came.. Waitress took order and that's all we saw of her, bathroom was a disaster... Then management wants to offer free apps.. Well never again Fridays! And I assure u I will tell everyone!!!!!!!!! Wish I would have know reviews b4 we ate there.
I don't like these kind of restaurants to begin with, best thing here are my friends. Service is so slow! Food too salty.

Still sitting waiting for our check after what I think is the worst meal/experience I have ever had to pay for. My sister in law and I ordered the Jack Daniels burger which we have had before by the way! It arrived with a sponge of a bun literally a wet nasty smushy gross bun. Who wants wet bread? When I brought it up to the manager he looked at the bread and said that its pretty common unless you order your meat well done... Hummmm. Sooo if my meat is not burnt I am going to have soggy bread? To top it off there was no sauce on my burger at all! It comes with sauce! My burger also tasted burnt! No pink and I ordered medium! Then to make matters worse my sister in law ordered a strawberry Margarita and they brought her the wrong drink and the same douche bag brought it out with the biggest ugliest strawberry the size of Godzilla and he used the same glass with lemons still in it? Really? Trashy! Horrible! Awful! This place is a sh** hole. By the way our actual waitress in training was great! Super sweet! I hope that idiot that is training her doesn't rub off on her! As for the douche bag idiot trainer he needs to be fired for his rude attitude. I will never eat here again ever. Thanks for the worst meal and service I've ever had! I would have rated this place a 0 and from the looks of it a lot of others agree!
came here for bday drinks for the cuzzo. the bartendar put on a show, i shoulda taken a pic.  the french fries were bomb that we ordered 2. just came here for dranks :)

I dunno. I have mixed feelings regarding this particular Friday's. I'm usually there for lunch and although not super busy, I seem to get crappy service ALL OF THE FRIGGIN' TIME! Why do I continue to subject myself to this, you ask? The answer lies in the Buy One, Get One Free coupons that I hoard. The food is good, very consistent.  If you want service, go to the Riverside Friday's.

We have been there many times, servers not the best.  Whenever we get our food is a long wait, few times food arrived cold.  This is not the best TGI Fridays in the area.  Not sure what is it about it, we have never had a great experience there.
Tried the gourmet Mac N Cheese.  It was surprisingly good lol  The portion was perfect and the taste was great.  I'll be trying it again next time I'm there.  Wait staff was very nice.

This is your typical All American food with a ok quality service. Sometimes its a hit or miss at this location. Whatever you do, just don't sit at the bar unless you are only planning on drinking, because you will never get to eat food. They take forever to bring your food.
Good food but if you ask for 2nds on soft drinks be ready to pay. Bread is also 99 cents for two! For those prices give us a break
had lunch with a business partner. looked very new. server and service was great. food was out in a good amoutn of time and it was tasty. good job.

Every time i come here i get the same dish because it is so darn delicious! I will get cravings for it now and then. Usually i get this dish for under $10 for some reason it was like $14...I dont know why this was but with the service I received it was so worth it. Our server was soo quirky and awesome. I wish I remembered his name he had my little brother and i laughing!! Thanks for the great time!!

I haven't been to Friday's in a while, in the past have had them add drinks never ordered/consumed onto the bill between reviewing the bill and getting the credit card bill. New manager now so thought we would give it a try again, hopefully the overcharging has stopped.  Went in, many tables empty. Was told to wait five mins...turned into 15. Never asked our name, just kept pointing to 'those people' waiting for a table. Many open tables, hostesses standing around, scratching their hair, joking with each other. Finally got seated in a table that had been empty the entire time. I personally think the hostess in a restaurant should have "front house" appearance, not look like a shower hadn't been had in days. Anyways, food ordered and took quite some time since a huge table was seated right by us.  Although seated after us, only 2 in our party, they were actually served first. When my food came out, the potato had sour cream draped across it in a very sloppy manner just slopped on, no butter or chives, as ordered. Potato was barely cooked, needed a steak knife to cut it...completely inedible. Manager came out...unsolicited...to see if everything was ok, assume he came out because he knew it certainly was NOT ok. Offered a new potato, no money off the bill or anything. At this point we have already waited over 45 mins for our food so no, I just won't eat the undercooked potato. No apology other than we had the misfortune of coming when the kitchen was backed up. REALLY...you are a restaurant and the place is 1/2 empty!   To be honest, this is one of the worst run places I have ever been with no excuses offered for their pitiful service.   And the dirty appearance of the hostess, scratching her head constantly because it appeared so unkempt, will keep any normal person away from this establishment which is a shame, the food at Friday's is better than the Corona establishment leads you to believe.

Many issues with this restaurant on this visit.  First, we ordered appetizers.  One of the kitchen helpers brought out the spinach dip but no chips and said she would be right back with the chips. Never happened.  Then I mentioned this to our server and she didn't bring the chips.  The manager came by and without asking he wondered where the chips were.  The manager went to get the chips and brought out another dip as the original dip was getting cold.  Ok, so this was good that the manager was willing to fix this.  Next the entree's arrived and the portion's were notably smaller than usual.  The taste was fine but as the prices have not come down 50% it appears that the restaurant is trying to up their profitability by cutting back on the portion sizes.  The time came to leave and when looking at the check I noticed that the bill contained 2 charges for the dip!  Overall a very disappointing experience.
The Jack Daniels Ribs weren't nearly as good as we have had at other TGI Fridays, which was very disappointing.

Food is BLAH. Dennys seems to have better service. The night life is for high schoolers with fake ids. Lots of fights with stupid el cerrito trash. If your over 21 go to the Alibi. Its safe there, better service, better music. If you want to have drama go to tgi. Sorry, but everything I go there is some punks driving daddys ford 250 truck starting trouble ALL THE TIME!

We were a party of six the other night and everything was great! The service was great - the waiter was friendly,  very attentive   and not pushy The food was surprisingly good  -  people loved their steaks, I loved the chicken and shrimp pasta and the appetizers were  wonderful.  Try the fried green beans, the potstickers and baked potato skins for starters.    I highly recommend this place and would go again in a heartbeat.
happy hour after 10pm.... cool spot.. live dj..   but its in corona.. so if ur around.. stop by.. dont travel outta ur way

Worse service anywhere!!! We decided that we should maybe give this big chain restaurant another try after having horrible service every time, and boy were we wrong! After our waiter decided to take a half hour break at 6:30 on a Friday night, we were only disappointed by the lack of any real care for the customers. The appetizer took at least a half hour to arrive and then another twenty minutes to get any other food. Certainly do not ever go here on a Friday night. I was thinking Thank goodness it was Friday until we went got to TGIF.

went there about a month ago the service was awful . took my neighbors for there first time we told them in was good . it was a sunday evening it took over 3 hours to be served missing meal missing sauces ask for a-1 they brought it when i went to use it was empty. then i wrote a comment on there website and the manager called me said he was sorry and that he would have to terminate the server because i had contacted corpate. he then promised to send me something and also my neighbors . for our bad experience. its been several weeks and nothing has came. i believe i figured out the problem the manager needs to be let go. no follow thru. the server probably had no help.

We sat by the patio and apparently according to our server one of the corporate big shot guys was out there with all his friends, clearly all drunk and still getting served. They would hold open the door and let all the smoke into the restaurant making eating very unpleasant. If corporate is going to act like this is a frat house party then this company will no longer be getting my money.

I've been here on several occasions. To be honest I'm not a huge fan of TGIF's food. Everything I've tried seems mediocre and a bit over priced. I mean the mozzarella appetizer is disappointing and that's usually good anywhere you go lol their mozzarella appetizer tasted like it had freezer burn. I've had multiple dishes that have shrimp or fish, and they were just okay. The last time I was here I ordered lobster, and it was TERRIBLE. The lobster was overcooked so much that getting the meat out of the shell was impossible. And the meat had an unusual taste, like spoiled lobster. I won't be coming back to this location ever again for food, maybe for a drink if family or friends insist on TGIF.

My friend and I just left this place without any help, any service. So we came after work to wind down and we sat at a Booth at the bar area. We sat there for about 5 minutes and NOBODY acknowledged us. Wasn't busy what so ever and servers passed by us as if we did not exist. Not even "we'll be right with you." So we we're still waiting few more minutes and a couple sat next to us. The little short asian girl who was a server, attended to them right away, gave them menus, aaand STILL ignored us. So we thought, "ok she's finally going to come up to us"..but NOPE, still ignored us. I MEAN NOBODY helped us at all. I spoke with a manager, he offered a free appetizer but we declined because a free appetizer will not make up for that horrible customer service. So we left, don't think I'll ever come back. Maybe if theres a new staff or these people get their shit together. My friend and I work customer service and that shit isn't rocket science. Be good to your customers. This place was never like this before, haven't been here in so long. Staff before were super attentive, I don't know what the hell happened now.

I was pretty disappointed with the food here... Service was great... But the size of the mahi mahi was really sad. I could've gotten my money's worth at California Fish Grill instead. The pasta was okay but I'm a little scared for tonight because I'm not sure the shrimp was cooked completely... The salad was the best part and it wasn't even the best.

Came her to visit with my family, we have been several times and loved it! Today was a different story! Waitress was very nice and understanding but we had to send back 3 meals! My steak was raw I had asked for a medium and my whole family agreed it was raw I cut the the middle it was cold. We had ordered the jack Daniels strip appetizer and they came very over cooked, hard to bite into and they were nuggets not "strips" never again would we order! My friend had orders the new mahi sandwich, it again was over cooked and extremely fishy all and all we had sent all 3 plates back! The chef came out to ask us what was wrong (so awkward) obviously he's not happy with us sending our food back. Mind you, I'm not picky and I do not complain but for how much you are paying it should be served correctly. Doubt we will be back, that's unfortunately. They did adjustment to our lunch which was very nice but again the food could have been better.

We have been coming to this Fridays for 5 years and have always had great service at the bar. The bartenders are great as well as the cocktail severs. Evan, Vanessa and Susan are always attentive and can make you any drink you ask for. The whole Fridays staff has always offered professional service making us feel at home which is why I will continue to come here. If you have any issues here Wade and Chris are always helpful. I would highly recommend coming here for any occasion.

I was totally skeptical of this restaurant. So far the majority of TGIFs I've visited are nothing to write home about but this one was great solely due to the tremendous service.  I paid a visit because there is a new karaoke show. KJ Rodney is such a great KJ! Fun and fair and just a great people-person. What impressed me the most was the bartender. After only seeing me just 1 time, 2wks later she remembered who I was and my drink and my husband (who wasn't even with me on my next visit).  Some may argue this is nothing but to me, it's everything.  People who love people are the luckiest people in the world. Food was good too. Stationary menu items but they are cooked well. Most TGIFs are overdone but so far everything has been cooked well with great, personable service.

Place is clean and overall friendly.  Server made several mistakes on a simple salad served late.  My steak and shrimp came with no shrimp till I asked.   Then I guess shrimp comes dry with no sauces and u have to ask.  A little disjointed making me and my disappointed.   Next time I will just get drunk at the bar.

Came here at 1:30 pm on Friday and sat in the bar area. Not busy by any means, took about 15 minutes to get our order taken & the wait to get our food wasn't bad. I never got a refill, I had to go up to the bar tender (since our server was MIA) to get a refill and also order something else. The food wasn't great. I go to the Friday's by the Tyler mall on a regular basis and their food is always great. Pretzel sticks were burned, the cheese dip had been sitting for quite some time, siracha wings lacked sauce (and I had to ask for ranch which I've never had to before). Overall, I'll be sticking with the Tyler street Friday's from now on since this one sucks

Ask for The bartender GREG, he is amazing! He is so nice and so patient, and to top it off the drink he suggested was amazing!! We went on a busy weekend night, and Greg managed the bar top flawlessly! I work in the industry and was very impressed! Greg is an asset to this restaurant!

I received some of the best consumer service here on Saturday, Feb 20th. Me and a friend were headed back home from a concert and was starving. It was 1:30am and knew this location stayed open until 2am. We decided we'd just order take out since it was so close to closing. We walked in and was greeted by Juan. We asked can we still place a take out order and he asked us would we care to dine in. We took that option and was treated as if it were 1pm in the afternoon. All of the servers and bartenders were pleasant and attentive, although it was closing time. In many restaurants, consumers don't get that level of professionalism during those last hours. We really appreciated the service and the food was hot and delicious. Keep up the outstanding work!
We got the 6 ounce jack Daniels steaks,  I've had better, it wasn't anything to write home about! I believe Outback serves a more tender sirloin!!

Food is good but lacking any kind of good service. We came for lunch today. Wasn't busy at all. Food came out fast but then we never saw our waiter again. I get up to ask for check and she's just standing on the way other side talking to another waiter.

Watered down drinks, food was disgusting, ordered a French dip sandwich, worse I've ever had. Au jus was thick and jelly like.  Server was at least friendly, but she didn't really tend to us. Not planning on going back anytime soon

We went on Veterans Day late afternoon and the restaurant became busy pretty quickly after we arrived.  Our food took forever.  We were getting pretty annoyed until the manager,  Wade, came over,  sincerely apologized and offered to cover our kid's meals and dessert.  We would have reviewed the experience as a 2 if not for the great turnaround from a manager who knows what customer service really means.

Cheap drinks for happy hour: Margarita Electric lemonade Long island  $5 each All appetizers are half off. Nachos with a side of salsa please !! there isn't a large good selection to choose from. Everything else is pretty meh.   Our bartender was pretty cool, she asked the DJ to turn down the music so we're not screaming on top of each other.

I'm not really one to have much to say about chain restaurants.... but with this one I had to. This was my second attempt at this location and both times it was an EPIC fail. They are extremely slow so make sure you give yourself enough time and don't show up when you are hungry. There was no Hostess available to greet us when we walked in, so we waited about 5 minutes as several workers walked right by us without acknowledging the fact that we had not been seated. Finally someone said hello and said he would get us a table right away. That didn't happen. He proceeded to write down all other parties on the waiting list. As soon as tables were available, he went down his list with 3 parties before I had to speak up at the fact that he skipped us.  When we were finally seated, we ordered fairly quick. Too bad that was the only quick thing that happened all night. Our food took almost 40 minutes to come out of the kitchen. I ordered the ribeye steak and baked potato with veggies. It all tasted a day old but I was just so tired that I did't complain. I just wanted to eat and get out of there. That is exactly what I did and I don't plan to return. Before picking up the check our waitress asked us if we wanted waters to go? Who does that?  Overall it was just a sucky experience. I'm not sure that I'll go back to TGIFridays again. I'm bummed about it because they have a really good happy hour and yummy drinks. I was able to give them 2 stars for that.

We always have great service and good food at this Fridays. I can't count how many times we have been in on weeknights, and several times on  weekends - honestly we keep coming back because of the Stripes program perks! But we wouldn't without having consistently great experiences. Friendly staff, quick service, good food and attention to detail on adjustments to a dish.  Can't speak for the bar because we always sit in the dining room.

Came here the other day to meet up with a friend for happy hour on Friday. Can you imagine visiting TGI Fridays on a Friday? Is that ironic or what? Ha! Of course we sat in the bar because we were there to indulge in happy hour. We had a few margaritas and ordered the Jack Daniel's sampler (shrimp, ribs, & boneless wings), mozzarella sticks, & fries. We ended up doing shots as well because the margaritas weren't strong @ all. Most food at Fridays is fried, so I never expect anything spectacular. We had a few different bartenders serving us so the service was pretty good. The bar @ this location is always pretty lively. Go during happy hour, take lots of shots, & have a good time! :-)

I can't necessarily say that I've undergone any negative experiences from this place, the most I can attest to is having received "meager" accommodations upon each visit. Everyone beneath the sun knows that Friday's is ---THE--- place to go when you're on a budget and in need of a stiff drink. Sadly, that's about as far as it goes. The food is .....engh. The service is.....engh and well all in all, the "Happy Hour" specials are what make this place a commodity and keep their name in circulation. Would I go back? Certainly. Would I travel out of my way,.....certainly not.

I know why this place was empty at lunch today (friday). Food over cooked. Service horrible.  Our server was engaged for 15 minutes with friends at another table. We ended up getting another server. I will never return.

My experience at this establishment was unpleasant from the very beginning, I stayed because I was trying to stay positive and give the place a chance but I will definitely not be driving out of my way to come here ever again. The bathrooms were filthy, paper towels everywhere. Our table literally got stolen like moved as we were on our way to be seated, appetizers took 20mins and all we got was mozzarella sticks. We both needed refills for 15mins until they finally got refilled. When we were seated nothing was wiped down before we sat down, the list goes on. The manager also never asked how we were doing as he was walking around or how our food was nor did our server, also the hostesses seemed to all have no idea what they were doing. If you can go anywhere else in the area I would because there are plenty other better options around.

My friend and I went for dinner on a Saturday night and it wasn't busy, which was nice..but the service was horrible. The waiter brought our food out before our drinks. Apparently she forgot. The food was good, but I won't go here again because service was horrible!

Jack Daniel's Baby Back Ribs are just as good as Phil's in San Diego and you don not have to wait 2 hours to get into the restaurant. Parm fries are a great side. Service was very good and efficient. I never had to ask for re-fills, the waitress would notice and take the initiative - as it should be. They have some great rib specials that they do not advertise, only a banner outside this particular location.

Came in here on a Sunday afternoon. Business was moderate, yet our server didn't really pay much attention to us. First they told us they don't serve some drinks that are being advertised online. That didn't really bother me (I understand that not all franchises carry the same products). So we ordered some other drinks with some appetizers, the drinks came like 10 mins. No straws, no utensils, nothing. Another 10 mins then our appetizers came out, still no utensils. After that our server rarely checked on us. Very poor service. Food was really greasy too.
Luv this place but today we tried the endless appetizers amongst the three of us and it took 30 min between each order and the manager wasn't too ple

I have been to several Friday's and by far this was the best experience I have had. Our waitress was Amazing (Devin) she came over several times refilling our drinks, she kept us updated on when our food would be out. She was very kid friendly. Our two children said how nice she was and we needed to tell the manager. (Which my kids have never said before) The food was very good with no complaints. I have to rate this 5 stars because of the moment we walked in and were greeted by the hostesses and host to the waitress and then the manager. I only wish we lived closer. Good Job Fridays
This place is amazing and the food is amazing. Come in and ask for Vanessa at the bar, she makes excellent drinks and is beautiful as can be!

Went today to enjoy some wings.   Walked in the bar looking for a table when the female bartender told us there were no clean tables and we need to go wait in the front. She was very rude!  We were shocked how rude she was about it. We walked to the front and told the very nice hostess what happened and we wanted to talk to the manager. She apologized and said she was not surprised. I walked back into the bar and told the bartender how rude she was and how she should have handled the situation. One of her regulars or whoever he was started yelling rude comments to me and my husband. The bartender just let him. Manager apologized and tried to get us to stay and even come back but we declined. Very disappointing.

The price was not worth the meal, they served a little bit which is annoying because compared to many places they serve a meal you'll get full off of no matter the price. On top of that the waiter was very rude and had an attitude with us. Very unsatisfactory. This restaurant made Tgi Friday's look very bad.
I literally love this restaurant! They are amazing! Great service and really nice. I haven't had a bad or even negative experience about this place. Keep up the good work!
OMG...yummy Service was awesome.   I had an empty plate..that rarely happens.   Trevor was great

The food was pretty mediocre. I got a classic cheeseburger, which was overcooked and bitter, and my friend got the crispy chicken fingers, which were pretty tough to chew. As if that wasn't enough, the fries were too salty too. But hey atleast their water was good.

I'm not from around these parts and it took me a good 1.5 hours to get here to meet up with some good girlfriends so I probably won't be coming back anytime soon but my experienced here was great.  It doesn't look like a typical Fridays from the outside. The inside is great, nice and big, modern and clean. The bar was HUGE! Great of course for their everyday happy hour specials :) Food and drinks is standard for your typical Fridays. Our server was sweet and attentive, and funny.

This TGI Fridays is a great location. I've been for happy hour a few times and the vibe during that time is great because it's very relaxed and friendly. The staff is friendly and our waitress allowed me to use my coupon for buy one entree and get a second free on appetizers which was great. I've never been to this location and had a bad experience. The food is also very delicious especially the jack daniel's menu

The food you get is decent. Its nothing absolutely amazing and sometimes can be considered mediocre. My stepdad ordered the French Dip Sandwich; it came out cold and it looked way smaller in proportion than it does on the menu. Speaking of portions I feel like you don't get very much food on your plate for the money you pay. I ordered the half rack of ribs and that was ok size however I only got a small handful of fries from what it looked like. The mashed potatoes were nothing spectacular but they were ok in quality. The time it took to serve us took a little long. There was probably less than 30 people in the restaurant but it took about 40 minutes to get our food. Even with that our waitress, Alexis was very friendly and attentive to us and with the other customers. I think with the ok quality food and the ok service I give TGI fridays in corona 3 stars.

2 for $20 menu rocks! Upgraded to Jack Daniels chicken (+$3) and petite sirloin (+3), and had green bean fries for an app. Everything was delicious. Server/Bartender SAM was awesome. Very happy with the experience and value.
Food is great! Love it! Service is kinda slow but the deals make up for it, had the steak and lobster for 15 and it was well worth the money! The drinks are kinda pricey but happy hour is nice..

Stopped in for dinner last night before our tax appointment.  The service was terrible- took 40 minutes to get our burgers.  To top off the wait, the fries were cold on each of our plates!  We didn't have time to complain as we needed to get to our appointment, but we will not go back to this location again.  Very disappointing.

I usually like this place. BUT today we had a disgusting experience. First they gave us a glass of orange juice with a bunch of black stuff at the bottom of the cup. Manager came out to apologized and said they would make sure to watch out for the rest of our food. Right after that when our food arrived my son open up his utensils and found a piece of old dried up rice between the forks. Manager came out again and offered us something else and said "promise that it won't have anymore surprises" needless to say we stopped eating and took off. WE WILL NOT BE BACK HERE!

I love the drinks here but be sure to take a good look at your bill when it arrives. I was over charged for a drink I did not have and the problem was not corrected. They punched in the drink in the computer and never brought it out and at the end of the night they said they did. Wish it hadn't happen because it left me feeling like I got ripped off!!

Well where do I start? Joe was great but she had here first party of 20 and she struggled to keep up. Long story short, it took us two hours to get our food and when the appetizer finally arrived it had a hair in it! See the pic!!!! Wade the "manager" was never to be found until I asked for him... even when the waitress burned herself and needed attention he never can out! What a leader!!! I know I will never return and I recommend you don't either.

I'm sure that TGI Friday's are not expecting this kind of  review.. Party of six came in for a nice birthday celebration dinner before going to the movies and here is the experience we had ... 1. Drink order- Coors Light on draft - unable to get due to being out!! On a Saturday night at 7:30pm.. WTF.  2. Attempted to order the unlimited appetizers - was told that it stopped a few days ago due to the menu was changing.. well it's still listed on the website I told the waiter.. his response was "There is a TGI Friday's in Riverside you guys can go to" and " I can transfer your bill". - Nice thing for your waiter to say.. Great customer service.. makes me want to come back!!! 3. Food was ordered and waiter was told that there was a Birthday at the table.  4. Food came out but we were missing a complete entree with a salad.. Salad never came before her dinner .. as all of us were eating I asked for the manager ..  5. Manager came to the table and I explained to him what the issue was and he stated " I will take care of it". As we all finished our dinners and the missing entree and salad was still NOT brought to the table !! We told our waiter to forget the food and to take it off the bill!!  6.
